1.text: Act quickly after hair dye gets on your hands.

2.text: Squeeze non-gel toothpaste into your hands and scrub.
2.vid: /c/c8/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Apply baby oil, olive oil, or petroleum jelly and allow it to sit overnight.
3.vid: /9/9e/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 3 Version 5.360p.mp4

4.text: Wash your hands with a combination of dish soap and baking soda.
4.vid: /7/7d/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 4 Version 5.360p.mp4

5.text: Rub makeup remover on your hands.
5.vid: /6/6b/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4

7.vid: /3/3b/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 7 Version 5.360p.mp4

8.text: Mix laundry detergent and baking soda and rub it into the stain.
8.vid: /6/65/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4

9.text: Make a paste from cigarette ashes and warm water.
9.vid: /a/a0/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4

10.text: Use nail polish remover if all else fails.
10.vid: /2/2a/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4

11.text: Saturate a cotton ball with nail polish remover.
11.vid: /1/1a/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 11 Version 5.360p.mp4

12.text: Trim your cuticles if they are dyed.

13.text: Use a nail brush or toothbrush to get under your nails.
13.vid: /5/5b/Get Hair Dye off Your Hands Step 13 Version 4.360p.mp4

14.text: Paint your nails if you just can't remove the dye.
